name: consul
description:
A Pulumi package for creating and managing consul resources.

> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-consul)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi/pulumi-consul` repo](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-consul/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-providers/terraform-provider-consul` repo](https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-consul/issues).

datacenters.description: The datacenters the effective policy is valid within.

address.description:
The address of the node being added to,
or referenced in the catalog.

name.deprecationMessage: Using consul_keys resource to *read* is deprecated; please use consul_keys data source instead

ttl.description: The TTL to send when returning DNS results.

datacenters.description: Remote datacenters to return results from.

nearestN.description:
Return results from this many datacenters,
sorted in ascending order of estimated RTT.

regexp.description:
The regular expression to match with. When using
`name_prefix_match`, this regex is applied against the query name.

type.description:
The type of template matching to perform. Currently
only `name_prefix_match` is supported.

checkId.description:
An ID, *unique per agent*. Will default to *name*
if not set.

deregisterCriticalServiceAfter.description:
The time after which
the service is automatically deregistered when in the `critical` state.
Defaults to `30s`.

headers.description:
The headers to send for an HTTP check.
The attributes of each header is given below.

http.description: The HTTP endpoint to call for an HTTP check.

interval.description:
The interval to wait between each health-check
invocation.

method.description:
The method to use for HTTP health-checks. Defaults
to `GET`.

name.description: The name of the header.

notes.description: An opaque field meant to hold human readable text.

tcp.description: The TCP address and port to connect to for a TCP check.

timeout.description: The timeout value for HTTP checks.

tlsSkipVerify.description:
Whether to deactivate certificate
verification for HTTP health-checks. Defaults to `false`.

name.description: The name of the header.
The name of the ACL Role.

dns.description:
A map of DNS configuration attributes.  See below for details on the
contents of the `dns` attribute.
* [`dns_recursors`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/options.html#recursors) - A
list of all DNS recursors.
* [`data_dir`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/options.html#_data_dir)
* [`datacenter`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/options.html#_datacenter)
* [`dev_mode`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/options.html#_dev)
* [`domain`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/options.html#_domain)
* [`enable_anonymous_signature`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/options.html#disable_anonymous_signature)
* `enable_coordinates`
* [`enable_debug`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/options.html#enable_debug)
* [`enable_remote_exec`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/options.html#disable_remote_exec)
* [`enable_syslog`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/options.html#_syslog)
* [`enable_ui`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/options.html#_ui)
* [`enable_update_check`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/options.html#disable_update_check)
* [`id`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/options.html#_node_id)
* [`leave_on_int`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/options.html#skip_leave_on_interrupt)
* [`leave_on_term`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/options.html#leave_on_terminate)
* [`log_level`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/options.html#_log_level)
* [`name`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/options.html#_node)
* [`performance`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/options.html#performance)
* [`pid_file`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/options.html#_pid_file)
* [`ports`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/options.html#ports)
* [`protocol_version`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/options.html#_protocol)

* [`reconnect_timeout_wan`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/options.html#reconnect_timeout_wan)

healthy.description:
Whether the server is healthy according to the current Autopilot
configuration

id.description: The Raft ID of the server

lastContact.description:
The time elapsed since the server's last contact with
the leader

lastIndex.description: The index of the server's last committed Raft log entry

lastTerm.description: The server's last known Raft leader term

leader.description: Whether the server is currently leader

name.description: The node name of the server

serfStatus.description: The status of the SerfHealth check of the server

stableSince.description:
The time this server has been in its current ``Healthy``
state

version.description: The Consul version of the server

voter.description: Whether the server is a voting member of the Raft cluster

id.description:
The Node ID of the Consul agent.
* [`meta`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/http/catalog.html#Meta) - Node meta
data tag information, if any.
* [`name`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/http/catalog.html#Node) - The name
of the Consul node.
* [`address`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/http/catalog.html#Address) - The
IP address the node is advertising to the Consul cluster.
* [`tagged_addresses`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/http/catalog.html#TaggedAddresses) -
List of explicit LAN and WAN IP addresses for the agent.

datacenter.description:
The Consul datacenter to query.  Defaults to the
same value found in `query_options` parameter specified below, or if that is
empty, the `datacenter` value found in the Consul agent that this provider is
configured to talk to then the datacenter in the provider setup.

node.description: The name of the node associated with this health-check.

id.description: The ID of this health-check.

name.description: The service name to select.

node.description: The name of the node associated with this health-check.

notes.description: A human readable description of the current state of the health-check.

serviceId.description: The ID of the service associated to this health-check.

serviceName.description: The name of the service associated with this health-check.

serviceTags.description: The list of tags associated with this health-check.

datacenter.description: The Consul datacenter to query.

id.description: The ID of this health-check.

meta.description: Service metadata tag information, if any.

name.description: The service name to select.

id.description: The ID of this health-check.

meta.description: Service metadata tag information, if any.

name.description: The service name to select.

tags.description: The list of tags associated with this instance.

datacenter.description:
The Consul datacenter to query.  Defaults to the
same value found in `query_options` parameter specified below, or if that is
empty, the `datacenter` value found in the Consul agent that this provider is
configured to talk to.

name.description: The service name to select.

nodeId.description:
The Node ID of the Consul agent advertising the service.
* [`node_meta`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/http/catalog.html#Meta) - Node
meta data tag information, if any.
* [`node_name`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/http/catalog.html#Node) - The
name of the Consul node.
* [`address`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/http/catalog.html#ServiceAddress) -
The IP address of the service.  If the `ServiceAddress` in the Consul catalog
is empty, this value is automatically populated with the `node_address` (the
`Address` in the Consul Catalog).
* [`enable_tag_override`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/http/catalog.html#ServiceEnableTagOverride) -
Whether service tags can be overridden on this service.
* [`id`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/http/catalog.html#ServiceID) - A
unique service instance identifier.
* [`name`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/http/catalog.html#ServiceName) - The
name of the service.
* [`port`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/http/catalog.html#ServicePort) -
Port number of the service.
* [`tagged_addresses`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/http/catalog.html#TaggedAddresses) -
List of explicit LAN and WAN IP addresses for the agent.
* [`tags`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/http/catalog.html#ServiceTags) -
List of tags for the service.
* [`meta`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/http/catalog.html#Meta) - Service meta
data tag information, if any.

datacenter.description:
The Consul datacenter to query.  Defaults to the
same value found in `query_options` parameter specified below, or if that is
empty, the `datacenter` value found in the Consul agent that this provider is
configured to talk to.

tags.description:
A map of the tags found for each service.  If more than one service
shares the same tag, unique service names will be joined by whitespace (this
is the inverse of `services` and can be used to lookup the services that match
a single tag).

provider.description:
The provider type for the consul package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-consul/blob/master/website/docs/index.html.markdown.

consul:index/aclAuthMethod:AclAuthMethod.description:
Starting with Consul 1.5.0, the consul..AclAuthMethod resource can be used to
managed Consul ACL auth methods.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-consul/blob/master/website/docs/r/acl_auth_method.markdown.

config.description: The raw configuration for this ACL auth method.

description.description: A free form human readable description of the auth method.

name.description: The name of the ACL auth method.

type.description: The type of the ACL auth method.

name.description: The name of the ACL auth method.

type.description: The type of the ACL auth method.

config.description: The raw configuration for this ACL auth method.

description.description: A free form human readable description of the auth method.

name.description: The name of the ACL auth method.

type.description: The type of the ACL auth method.

consul:index/aclBindingRule:AclBindingRu.description:
Starting with Consul 1.5.0, the consul..AclBindingRule resource can be used to
managed Consul ACL binding rules.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-consul/blob/master/website/docs/r/acl_binding_rule.markdown.

authMethod.description: The name of the ACL auth method this rule apply.

bindName.description: The name to bind to a token at login-time.

bindType.description:
Specifies the way the binding rule affects a token
created at login.

description.description:
A free form human readable description of the
binding rule.

selector.description:
The expression used to math this rule against valid
identities returned from an auth method validation.

authMethod.description: The name of the ACL auth method this rule apply.

bindName.description: The name to bind to a token at login-time.

bindType.description:
Specifies the way the binding rule affects a token
created at login.

description.description:
A free form human readable description of the
binding rule.

selector.description:
The expression used to math this rule against valid
identities returned from an auth method validation.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering AclBindingRule resources.

authMethod.description: The name of the ACL auth method this rule apply.

bindName.description: The name to bind to a token at login-time.

bindType.description:
Specifies the way the binding rule affects a token
created at login.

description.description:
A free form human readable description of the
binding rule.

selector.description:
The expression used to math this rule against valid
identities returned from an auth method validation.

consul:index/aclPolicy:AclPolicy.description:
Starting with Consul 1.4.0, the consul..AclPolicy can be used to managed Consul ACL policies.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-consul/blob/master/website/docs/r/acl_policy.html.markdown.

description.description: The description of the policy.

name.description: The name of the policy.

description.description: The description of the policy.

name.description: The name of the policy.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering AclPolicy resources.

description.description: The description of the policy.

name.description: The name of the policy.

consul:index/aclRole:AclRole.description:
Starting with Consul 1.5.0, the consul..AclRole can be used to managed Consul ACL roles.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-consul/blob/master/website/docs/r/acl_role.markdown.

description.description: A free form human readable description of the role.

name.description: The name of the ACL role.

policies.description: The list of policies that should be applied to the role.

serviceIdentities.description:
The list of service identities that should
be applied to the role.

description.description: A free form human readable description of the role.

name.description: The name of the ACL role.

policies.description: The list of policies that should be applied to the role.

serviceIdentities.description:
The list of service identities that should
be applied to the role.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering AclRole resources.

description.description: A free form human readable description of the role.

name.description: The name of the ACL role.

policies.description: The list of policies that should be applied to the role.

serviceIdentities.description:
The list of service identities that should
be applied to the role.

consul:index/aclToken:AclToken.description:
The `consul..AclToken` resource writes an ACL token into Consul.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-consul/blob/master/website/docs/r/acl_token.html.markdown.

accessorId.description:
The uuid of the token. If omitted, Consul will
generate a random uuid.

description.description: The description of the token.

local.description: The flag to set the token local to the current datacenter.

policies.description: The list of policies attached to the token.

accessorId.description:
The uuid of the token. If omitted, Consul will
generate a random uuid.

description.description: The description of the token.

local.description: The flag to set the token local to the current datacenter.

policies.description: The list of policies attached to the token.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering AclToken resources.

accessorId.description:
The uuid of the token. If omitted, Consul will
generate a random uuid.

description.description: The description of the token.

local.description: The flag to set the token local to the current datacenter.

policies.description: The list of policies attached to the token.

policy.description: The name of the policy attached to the token.
The name of the policy attached to the token.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering AclTokenPolicyAttachment resources.

policy.description: The name of the policy attached to the token.

consul:index/agentService:AgentService.description:
!> The `consul..AgentService` resource has been deprecated in version 2.0.0 of the provider
and will be removed in a future release. Please read the [upgrade guide](https://www.terraform.io/docs/providers/consul/upgrading.html#deprecation-of-consul_agent_service)
for more information.

Provides access to the agent service data in Consul. This can be used to
define a service associated with a particular agent. Currently, defining
health checks for an agent service is not supported.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-consul/blob/master/website/docs/r/agent_service.html.markdown.

address.description:
The address of the service. Defaults to the
address of the agent.

name.description: The name of the service.

tags.description:
A list of values that are opaque to Consul,
but can be used to distinguish between services or nodes.

address.description:
The address of the service. Defaults to the
address of the agent.

name.description: The name of the service.

tags.description:
A list of values that are opaque to Consul,
but can be used to distinguish between services or nodes.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering AgentService resources.

address.description:
The address of the service. Defaults to the
address of the agent.

name.description: The name of the service.

tags.description:
A list of values that are opaque to Consul,
but can be used to distinguish between services or nodes.

consul:index/autopilotConfig:AutopilotCo.description:
Provides access to the [Autopilot Configuration](https://www.consul.io/docs/guides/autopilot.html)
of Consul to automatically manage Consul servers.

It includes to automatically cleanup dead servers, monitor the status of the Raft
cluster and stable server introduction.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-consul/blob/master/website/docs/r/autopilot_config.html.markdown.

cleanupDeadServers.description:
Whether to remove failing servers when a
replacement comes online. Defaults to true.

datacenter.description:
The datacenter to use. This overrides the agent's
default datacenter and the datacenter in the provider setup.

disableUpgradeMigration.description:
Whether to disable [upgrade migrations](https://www.consul.io/docs/guides/autopilot.html#redundancy-zones).
Defaults to false.

lastContactThreshold.description:
The time after which a server is
considered as unhealthy and will be removed. Defaults to `"200ms"`.

maxTrailingLogs.description:
The maximum number of Raft log entries a
server can trail the leader. Defaults to 250.

redundancyZoneTag.description:
The [redundancy zone](https://www.consul.io/docs/guides/autopilot.html#redundancy-zones)
tag to use. Consul will try to keep one voting server by zone to take advantage
of isolated failure domains. Defaults to an empty string.

serverStabilizationTime.description:
The period to wait for a server to be
healthy and stable before being promoted to a full, voting member. Defaults to
`"10s"`.

upgradeVersionTag.description:
The tag to override the version information
used during a migration. Defaults to an empty string.

cleanupDeadServers.description:
Whether to remove failing servers when a
replacement comes online. Defaults to true.

datacenter.description:
The datacenter to use. This overrides the agent's
default datacenter and the datacenter in the provider setup.

disableUpgradeMigration.description:
Whether to disable [upgrade migrations](https://www.consul.io/docs/guides/autopilot.html#redundancy-zones).
Defaults to false.

lastContactThreshold.description:
The time after which a server is
considered as unhealthy and will be removed. Defaults to `"200ms"`.

maxTrailingLogs.description:
The maximum number of Raft log entries a
server can trail the leader. Defaults to 250.

redundancyZoneTag.description:
The [redundancy zone](https://www.consul.io/docs/guides/autopilot.html#redundancy-zones)
tag to use. Consul will try to keep one voting server by zone to take advantage
of isolated failure domains. Defaults to an empty string.

serverStabilizationTime.description:
The period to wait for a server to be
healthy and stable before being promoted to a full, voting member. Defaults to
`"10s"`.

upgradeVersionTag.description:
The tag to override the version information
used during a migration. Defaults to an empty string.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering AutopilotConfig resources.

cleanupDeadServers.description:
Whether to remove failing servers when a
replacement comes online. Defaults to true.

datacenter.description:
The datacenter to use. This overrides the agent's
default datacenter and the datacenter in the provider setup.

disableUpgradeMigration.description:
Whether to disable [upgrade migrations](https://www.consul.io/docs/guides/autopilot.html#redundancy-zones).
Defaults to false.

lastContactThreshold.description:
The time after which a server is
considered as unhealthy and will be removed. Defaults to `"200ms"`.

maxTrailingLogs.description:
The maximum number of Raft log entries a
server can trail the leader. Defaults to 250.

redundancyZoneTag.description:
The [redundancy zone](https://www.consul.io/docs/guides/autopilot.html#redundancy-zones)
tag to use. Consul will try to keep one voting server by zone to take advantage
of isolated failure domains. Defaults to an empty string.

serverStabilizationTime.description:
The period to wait for a server to be
healthy and stable before being promoted to a full, voting member. Defaults to
`"10s"`.

upgradeVersionTag.description:
The tag to override the version information
used during a migration. Defaults to an empty string.

consul:index/catalogEntry:CatalogEntry.description:
!> The `consul..CatalogEntry` resource has been deprecated in version 2.0.0 of the provider
and will be removed in a future release. Please read the [upgrade guide](https://www.terraform.io/docs/providers/consul/upgrading.html#deprecation-of-consul_catalog_entry)
for more information.

Registers a node or service with the [Consul Catalog](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/http/catalog.html#catalog_register).
Currently, defining health checks is not supported.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-consul/blob/master/website/docs/r/catalog_entry.html.markdown.

address.description:
The address of the node being added to,
or referenced in the catalog.

datacenter.description:
The datacenter to use. This overrides the
agent's default datacenter and the datacenter in the provider setup.

node.description:
The name of the node being added to, or
referenced in the catalog.

services.description:
A service to optionally associated with
the node. Supported values are documented below.

address.description:
The address of the node being added to,
or referenced in the catalog.

datacenter.description:
The datacenter to use. This overrides the
agent's default datacenter and the datacenter in the provider setup.

node.description:
The name of the node being added to, or
referenced in the catalog.

services.description:
A service to optionally associated with
the node. Supported values are documented below.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering CatalogEntry resources.

address.description:
The address of the node being added to,
or referenced in the catalog.

datacenter.description:
The datacenter to use. This overrides the
agent's default datacenter and the datacenter in the provider setup.

node.description:
The name of the node being added to, or
referenced in the catalog.

services.description:
A service to optionally associated with
the node. Supported values are documented below.

consul:index/configEntry:ConfigEntry.description:
The [Configuration Entry](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/config_entries.html)
resource can be used to provide cluster-wide defaults for various aspects of
Consul.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-consul/blob/master/website/docs/r/config_entry.markdown.

configJson.description: An arbitrary map of configuration values.

kind.description: The kind of configuration entry to register.

name.description: The name of the configuration entry being registred.

configJson.description: An arbitrary map of configuration values.

kind.description: The kind of configuration entry to register.

name.description: The name of the configuration entry being registred.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering ConfigEntry resources.

configJson.description: An arbitrary map of configuration values.

kind.description: The kind of configuration entry to register.

name.description: The name of the configuration entry being registred.

consul:index/intention:Intention.description:
[Intentions](https://www.consul.io/docs/connect/intentions.html) are used to define
rules for which services may connect to one another when using [Consul Connect](https://www.consul.io/docs/connect/index.html).

It is appropriate to either reference existing services or specify non-existent services
that will be created in the future when creating intentions. This resource can be used
in conjunction with the `consul..Service` datasource when referencing services
registered on nodes that have a running Consul agent.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-consul/blob/master/website/docs/r/intention.html.markdown.

action.description: The intention action. Must be one of `allow` or `deny`.

description.description:
Optional description that can be used by Consul
tooling, but is not used internally.

destinationName.description:
The name of the destination service for the intention. This
service does not have to exist.

meta.description:
Key/value pairs that are opaque to Consul and are associated
with the intention.

sourceName.description:
The name of the source service for the intention. This
service does not have to exist.

action.description: The intention action. Must be one of `allow` or `deny`.

description.description:
Optional description that can be used by Consul
tooling, but is not used internally.

destinationName.description:
The name of the destination service for the intention. This
service does not have to exist.

meta.description:
Key/value pairs that are opaque to Consul and are associated
with the intention.

sourceName.description:
The name of the source service for the intention. This
service does not have to exist.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering Intention resources.

action.description: The intention action. Must be one of `allow` or `deny`.

description.description:
Optional description that can be used by Consul
tooling, but is not used internally.

destinationName.description:
The name of the destination service for the intention. This
service does not have to exist.

meta.description:
Key/value pairs that are opaque to Consul and are associated
with the intention.

sourceName.description:
The name of the source service for the intention. This
service does not have to exist.

datacenter.description:
The datacenter to use. This overrides the
agent's default datacenter and the datacenter in the provider setup.

pathPrefix.description:
Specifies the common prefix shared by all keys
that will be managed by this resource instance. In most cases this will
end with a slash, to manage a "folder" of keys.

subkeyCollection.description:
A subkey to add. Supported values documented below.
Multiple blocks supported.

subkeys.description:
A mapping from subkey name (which will be appended
to the given `path_prefix`) to the value that should be stored at that key.
Use slashes, as shown in the above example, to create "sub-folders" under
the given path prefix.

token.description:
The ACL token to use. This overrides the
token that the agent provides by default.

The datacenter to use. This overrides the
agent's default datacenter and the datacenter in the provider setup.

that will be managed by this resource instance. In most cases this will
end with a slash, to manage a "folder" of keys.

Multiple blocks supported.

subkeys.description:
A mapping from subkey name (which will be appended
to the given `path_prefix`) to the value that should be stored at that key.

the given path prefix.

token.description:

token that the agent provides by default.

consul:index/node:Node.description:
Provides access to Node data in Consul. This can be used to define a
node. Currently, defining health checks is not supported.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-consul/blob/master/website/docs/r/node.html.markdown.

address.description:
The address of the node being added to,
or referenced in the catalog.

datacenter.description:
The datacenter to use. This overrides the agent's
default datacenter and the datacenter in the provider setup.

meta.description: Key/value pairs that are associated with the node.

name.description:
The name of the node being added to, or
referenced in the catalog.

address.description:
The address of the node being added to,
or referenced in the catalog.

datacenter.description:
The datacenter to use. This overrides the agent's
default datacenter and the datacenter in the provider setup.

meta.description: Key/value pairs that are associated with the node.

name.description:
The name of the node being added to, or
referenced in the catalog.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering Node resources.

address.description:
The address of the node being added to,
or referenced in the catalog.

datacenter.description:
The datacenter to use. This overrides the agent's
default datacenter and the datacenter in the provider setup.

meta.description: Key/value pairs that are associated with the node.

name.description:
The name of the node being added to, or
referenced in the catalog.

connect.description:
When `true` the prepared query will return connect
proxy services for a queried service.  Conditions such as `tags` in the
prepared query will be matched against the proxy service. Defaults to false.

datacenter.description:
The datacenter to use. This overrides the
agent's default datacenter and the datacenter in the provider setup.

dns.description: Settings for controlling the DNS response details.

failover.description:
Options for controlling behavior when no healthy
nodes are available in the local DC.

name.description:
The name of the prepared query. Used to identify
the prepared query during requests. Can be specified as an empty string
to configure the query as a catch-all.

near.description:
Allows specifying the name of a node to sort results
near using Consul's distance sorting and network coordinates. The magic
`_agent` value can be used to always sort nearest the node servicing the
request.

onlyPassing.description:
When `true`, the prepared query will only
return nodes with passing health checks in the result.

service.description: The name of the service to query.

session.description:
The name of the Consul session to tie this query's
lifetime to.  This is an advanced parameter that should not be used without a
complete understanding of Consul sessions and the implications of their use
(it is recommended to leave this blank in nearly all cases).  If this
parameter is omitted the query will not expire.

storedToken.description:
The ACL token to store with the prepared
query. This token will be used by default whenever the query is executed.

tags.description:
The list of required and/or disallowed tags.  If a tag is
in this list it must be present.  If the tag is preceded with a "!" then it is
disallowed.

template.description:
Query templating options. This is used to make a
single prepared query respond to many different requests.

token.description:
The ACL token to use when saving the prepared query.
This overrides the token that the agent provides by default.

connect.description:
When `true` the prepared query will return connect
proxy services for a queried service.  Conditions such as `tags` in the
prepared query will be matched against the proxy service. Defaults to false.

datacenter.description:
The datacenter to use. This overrides the
agent's default datacenter and the datacenter in the provider setup.

dns.description: Settings for controlling the DNS response details.

failover.description:
Options for controlling behavior when no healthy
nodes are available in the local DC.

name.description:
The name of the prepared query. Used to identify
the prepared query during requests. Can be specified as an empty string
to configure the query as a catch-all.

near.description:
Allows specifying the name of a node to sort results
near using Consul's distance sorting and network coordinates. The magic
`_agent` value can be used to always sort nearest the node servicing the
request.

onlyPassing.description:
When `true`, the prepared query will only
return nodes with passing health checks in the result.

service.description: The name of the service to query.

session.description:
The name of the Consul session to tie this query's
lifetime to.  This is an advanced parameter that should not be used without a
complete understanding of Consul sessions and the implications of their use
(it is recommended to leave this blank in nearly all cases).  If this
parameter is omitted the query will not expire.

storedToken.description:
The ACL token to store with the prepared
query. This token will be used by default whenever the query is executed.

tags.description:
The list of required and/or disallowed tags.  If a tag is
in this list it must be present.  If the tag is preceded with a "!" then it is
disallowed.

template.description:
Query templating options. This is used to make a
single prepared query respond to many different requests.

token.description:
The ACL token to use when saving the prepared query.
This overrides the token that the agent provides by default.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering PreparedQuery resources.

connect.description:
When `true` the prepared query will return connect
proxy services for a queried service.  Conditions such as `tags` in the
prepared query will be matched against the proxy service. Defaults to false.

datacenter.description:
The datacenter to use. This overrides the
agent's default datacenter and the datacenter in the provider setup.

dns.description: Settings for controlling the DNS response details.

failover.description:
Options for controlling behavior when no healthy
nodes are available in the local DC.

name.description:
The name of the prepared query. Used to identify
the prepared query during requests. Can be specified as an empty string
to configure the query as a catch-all.

near.description:
Allows specifying the name of a node to sort results
near using Consul's distance sorting and network coordinates. The magic
`_agent` value can be used to always sort nearest the node servicing the
request.

onlyPassing.description:
When `true`, the prepared query will only
return nodes with passing health checks in the result.

service.description: The name of the service to query.

session.description:
The name of the Consul session to tie this query's
lifetime to.  This is an advanced parameter that should not be used without a
complete understanding of Consul sessions and the implications of their use
(it is recommended to leave this blank in nearly all cases).  If this
parameter is omitted the query will not expire.

storedToken.description:
The ACL token to store with the prepared
query. This token will be used by default whenever the query is executed.

tags.description:
The list of required and/or disallowed tags.  If a tag is
in this list it must be present.  If the tag is preceded with a "!" then it is
disallowed.

template.description:
Query templating options. This is used to make a
single prepared query respond to many different requests.

token.description:
The ACL token to use when saving the prepared query.
This overrides the token that the agent provides by default.

consul:index/service:Service.description:
A high-level resource for creating a Service in Consul in the Consul catalog. This
is appropriate for registering [external services](https://www.consul.io/docs/guides/external.html) and
can be used to create services addressable by Consul that cannot be registered
with a [local agent](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/basics.html).

If the Consul agent is running on the node where this service is registered, it is
not recommended to use this resource.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-consul/blob/master/website/docs/r/service.html.markdown.

address.description:
The address of the service. Defaults to the
address of the node.

datacenter.description:
The datacenter to use. This overrides the
agent's default datacenter and the datacenter in the provider setup.

external.deprecationMessage: The external field has been deprecated and does nothing.

meta.description:
A map of arbitrary KV metadata linked to the service
instance.

name.description: The name of the header.

node.description: The name of the node the to register the service on.

tags.description:
A list of values that are opaque to Consul,
but can be used to distinguish between services or nodes.

address.description:
The address of the service. Defaults to the
address of the node.

datacenter.description:
The datacenter to use. This overrides the
agent's default datacenter and the datacenter in the provider setup.

external.deprecationMessage: The external field has been deprecated and does nothing.

meta.description:
A map of arbitrary KV metadata linked to the service
instance.

name.description: The name of the header.

node.description: The name of the node the to register the service on.

tags.description:
A list of values that are opaque to Consul,
but can be used to distinguish between services or nodes.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering Service resources.

address.description:
The address of the service. Defaults to the
address of the node.

datacenter.description:
The datacenter to use. This overrides the
agent's default datacenter and the datacenter in the provider setup.

external.deprecationMessage: The external field has been deprecated and does nothing.

meta.description:
A map of arbitrary KV metadata linked to the service
instance.

name.description: The name of the header.

node.description: The name of the node the to register the service on.

tags.description:
A list of values that are opaque to Consul,
but can be used to distinguish between services or nodes.

consul:index/getAclAuthMethod:getAclAuth.description:
The `consul..AclAuthMethod` data source returns the information related to a
[Consul Auth Method](https://www.consul.io/docs/acl/acl-auth-methods.html).

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-consul/blob/master/website/docs/d/acl_auth_method.html.markdown.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getAclAuthMethod.

name.description: The name of the ACL Auth Method.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getAclAuthMethod.

config.description: The configuration options of the ACL Auth Method.

description.description: The description of the ACL Auth Method.

id.description: id is the provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

type.description: The type of the ACL Auth Method.

consul:index/getAclPolicy:getAclPolicy.description:
The `consul..AclPolicy` data source returns the information related to a
[Consul ACL Policy](https://www.consul.io/docs/acl/acl-system.html#acl-policies).

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-consul/blob/master/website/docs/d/acl_policy.html.markdown.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getAclPolicy.

name.description: The name of the ACL Policy.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getAclPolicy.

datacenters.description: The datacenters associated with the ACL Policy.

description.description: The description of the ACL Policy.

id.description: id is the provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

rules.description: The rules associated with the ACL Policy.

consul:index/getAclRole:getAclRole.description:
The `consul..AclRole` data source returns the information related to a
[Consul ACL Role](https://www.consul.io/api/acl/roles.html).

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-consul/blob/master/website/docs/d/acl_role.html.markdown.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getAclRole.

name.description: The name of the ACL Role.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getAclRole.

description.description: The description of the ACL Role.

id.description: id is the provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

policies.description:
The list of policies associated with the ACL Role. Each entry has
an `id` and a `name` attribute.

serviceIdentities.description:
The list of service identities associated with the ACL
Role. Each entry has a `service_name` attribute and a list of `datacenters`.

consul:index/getAclToken:getAclToken.description:
The `consul..AclToken` data source returns the information related to the
`consul..AclToken` resource with the exception of its secret ID.

If you want to get the secret ID associated with a token, use the
[`consul..getAclTokenSecretId` data source](https://www.terraform.io/docs/providers/consul/d/acl_token_secret_id.html).

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-consul/blob/master/website/docs/d/acl_token.html.markdown.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getAclToken.

accessorId.description: The accessor ID of the ACL token.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getAclToken.

description.description: The description of the ACL token.

id.description: id is the provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

local.description: Whether the ACL token is local to the datacenter it was created within.

policies.description:
A list of policies associated with the ACL token. Each entry has
an `id` and a `name` attribute.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getAclTokenSecretId.

accessorId.description: The accessor ID of the ACL token.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getAclTokenSecretId.

id.description: id is the provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

secretId.description: The secret ID of the ACL token if `gpg_key` has not been set.

consul:index/getAgentConfig:getAgentConf.description:
> **Note:** The `consul..getAgentConfig` resource differs from [`consul..getAgentSelf`](https://www.terraform.io/docs/providers/consul/d/agent_self.html),
providing less information but utilizing stable APIs. `consul..getAgentSelf` will be
deprecated in a future release.

The `consul..getAgentConfig` data source returns
[configuration data](https://www.consul.io/api/agent.html#read-configuration)
from the agent specified in the `provider`.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-consul/blob/master/website/docs/d/agent_config.html.markdown.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getAgentConfig.

datacenter.description: The datacenter the agent is running in

id.description: id is the provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

nodeId.description: The ID of the node the agent is running on

nodeName.description: The name of the node the agent is running on

revision.description: The first 9 characters of the VCS revision of the build of Consul that is running

server.description: Boolean if the agent is a server or not

version.description: The version of the build of Consul that is running

consul:index/getAgentSelf:getAgentSelf.description:
> **Warning:** The `consul..getAgentSelf` resource has been deprecated and will be removed
from a future release of the provider. Read the [upgrade instructions](https://www.terraform.io/docs/providers/consul/upgrading.html#deprecation-of-consul_agent_self) for more information.


The `consul..getAgentSelf` data source returns
[configuration and status data](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/http/agent.html#agent_self)
from the agent specified in the `provider`.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-consul/blob/master/website/docs/d/agent_self.html.markdown.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getAgentSelf.

dns.description:
A map of DNS configuration attributes.  See below for details on the
contents of the `dns` attribute.
* [`dns_recursors`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/options.html#recursors) - A
list of all DNS recursors.
* [`data_dir`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/options.html#_data_dir)
* [`datacenter`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/options.html#_datacenter)
* [`dev_mode`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/options.html#_dev)
* [`domain`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/options.html#_domain)
* [`enable_anonymous_signature`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/options.html#disable_anonymous_signature)
* `enable_coordinates`
* [`enable_debug`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/options.html#enable_debug)
* [`enable_remote_exec`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/options.html#disable_remote_exec)
* [`enable_syslog`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/options.html#_syslog)
* [`enable_ui`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/options.html#_ui)
* [`enable_update_check`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/options.html#disable_update_check)
* [`id`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/options.html#_node_id)
* [`leave_on_int`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/options.html#skip_leave_on_interrupt)
* [`leave_on_term`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/options.html#leave_on_terminate)
* [`log_level`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/options.html#_log_level)
* [`name`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/options.html#_node)

version.description:
The version of the Consul agent.
* `version_prerelease`
* `version_revision`

consul:index/getAutopilotHealth:getAutop.description:
The `consul..getAutopilotHealth` data source returns
[autopilot health information](https://www.consul.io/api/operator/autopilot.html#read-health)
about the current Consul cluster.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-consul/blob/master/website/docs/d/autopilot_health.html.markdown.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getAutopilotHealth.

datacenter.description:
The datacenter to use. This overrides the agent's
default datacenter and the datacenter in the provider setup.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getAutopilotHealth.

failureTolerance.description:
The number of redundant healthy servers that could fail
without causing an outage

healthy.description:
Whether the server is healthy according to the current Autopilot
configuration

id.description: id is the provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

servers.description:
A list of server health information. See below for details on the
available information.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getCatalogNodes.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getCatalogNodes.

id.description: id is the provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getCatalogService.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getCatalogService.

id.description: id is the provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getCatalogServices.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getCatalogServices.

id.description: id is the provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getKeyPrefix.

datacenter.description:
The datacenter to use. This overrides the
agent's default datacenter and the datacenter in the provider setup.

pathPrefix.description:
Specifies the common prefix shared by all keys
that will be read by this data source instance. In most cases, this will
end with a slash to read a "folder" of subkeys.

subkeyCollection.description:
Specifies a subkey in Consul to be read. Supported
values documented below. Multiple blocks supported.

token.description:
The ACL token to use. This overrides the
token that the agent provides by default.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getKeyPrefix.

datacenter.description: The datacenter the keys are being read from.

id.description: id is the provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

pathPrefix.description:
the common prefix shared by all keys being read.
* `var.<name>` - For each name given, the corresponding attribute
has the value of the key.

subkeys.description:
A map of the subkeys and values is set if no `subkey`
block is provided.

consul:index/getKeys:getKeys.description:
The `consul..Keys` resource reads values from the Consul key/value store.
This is a powerful way dynamically set values in templates.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-consul/blob/master/website/docs/d/keys.html.markdown.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getKeys.

datacenter.description:
The datacenter to use. This overrides the
agent's default datacenter and the datacenter in the provider setup.

keys.description:
Specifies a key in Consul to be read. Supported
values documented below. Multiple blocks supported.

token.description:
The ACL token to use. This overrides the
token that the agent provides by default.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getKeys.

datacenter.description:
The datacenter the keys are being read from.
* `var.<name>` - For each name given, the corresponding attribute
has the value of the key.

id.description: id is the provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

consul:index/getNodes:getNodes.description:
The `consul..getNodes` data source returns a list of Consul nodes that have
been registered with the Consul cluster in a given datacenter.  By specifying a
different datacenter in the `query_options` it is possible to retrieve a list of
nodes from a different WAN-attached Consul datacenter.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-consul/blob/master/website/docs/d/nodes.html.markdown.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getNodes.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getNodes.

datacenter.description: The datacenter the keys are being read from to.

id.description: id is the provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

nodeIds.description: A list of the Consul node IDs.

nodeNames.description: A list of the Consul node names.

nodes.description:
A list of nodes and details about each Consul agent.  The list of
per-node attributes is detailed below.

consul:index/getService:getService.description:
`consul..Service` provides details about a specific Consul service in a
given datacenter.  The results include a list of nodes advertising the specified
service, the node's IP address, port number, node ID, etc.  By specifying a
different datacenter in the `query_options` it is possible to retrieve a list of
services from a different WAN-attached Consul datacenter.

This data source is different from the `consul..getServices` (plural) data
source, which provides a summary of the current Consul services.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-consul/blob/master/website/docs/d/service.html.markdown.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getService.

datacenter.description:
The Consul datacenter to query.  Defaults to the
same value found in `query_options` parameter specified below, or if that is
empty, the `datacenter` value found in the Consul agent that this provider is
configured to talk to.

name.description: The service name to select.

tag.description:
A single tag that can be used to filter the list of nodes
to return based on a single matching tag..

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getService.

datacenter.description: The datacenter the keys are being read from to.

id.description: id is the provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

name.description: The name of the service

services.description:
A list of nodes and details about each endpoint advertising a
service.  Each element in the list is a map of attributes that correspond to
each individual node.  The list of per-node attributes is detailed below.

tag.description: The name of the tag used to filter the list of nodes in `service`.

consul:index/getServiceHealth:getService.description:
`consul..getServiceHealth` can be used to get the list of the instances that
are currently healthy, according to their associated  health-checks.
The result includes the list of service instances, the node associated to each
instance and its health-checks.

This resource is likely to change as frequently as the health-checks are being
updated, you should expect different results in a frequent basis.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-consul/blob/master/website/docs/d/service_health.html.markdown.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getServiceHealth.

datacenter.description: The Consul datacenter to query.

name.description: The service name to select.

near.description:
Specifies a node name to sort the node list in ascending order
based on the estimated round trip time from that node.

nodeMeta.description:
Filter the results to nodes with the specified key/value
pairs.

passing.description:
Whether to return only nodes with all checks in the
passing state. Defaults to `true`.

tag.description:
A single tag that can be used to filter the list to return
based on a single matching tag.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getServiceHealth.

datacenter.description:
The datacenter in which the node is running.
* [`tagged_addresses`](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/http/catalog.html#TaggedAddresses) -
List of explicit LAN and WAN IP addresses for the agent.

id.description: id is the provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

name.description: The name of this health-check.

near.description: The node to which the result must be sorted to.

nodeMeta.description: The list of metadata to filter the nodes.

passing.description:
Whether to return only nodes with all checks in the
passing state.

results.description:
A list of entries and details about each endpoint advertising a
service.  Each element in the list has three attributes: `node`, `service` and
`checks`.  The list of the attributes of each one is detailed below.

tag.description: The name of the tag used to filter the list.

consul:index/getServices:getServices.description:
The `consul..getServices` data source returns a list of Consul services that
have been registered with the Consul cluster in a given datacenter.  By
specifying a different datacenter in the `query_options` it is possible to
retrieve a list of services from a different WAN-attached Consul datacenter.

This data source is different from the `consul..Service` (singular) data
source, which provides a detailed response about a specific Consul service.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-consul/blob/master/website/docs/d/services.html.markdown.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getServices.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getServices.

datacenter.description: The datacenter the keys are being read from to.

id.description: id is the provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing consul resources.
